result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyara A Hall-Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges(including DNA) within 4 Months. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept.  
Court order all other non mandatory cost, fees and surcharges waived due to indigency.
Maintain full employment and or schooling.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Parenting Class.
Referral to Vocational and Rehabilitation program.
Cognitive intervention program.
Letter of apology to: J, C Penney.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keyara A Hall-Jefferson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Sentencing hearing held:Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.


COUNT 1: 
The court sentenced the defendant to  6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 Months.
If revoked 4 days credit for time served to be applied  to Stayed time and Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and dependency care.							

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
60 Days of Condition time; Imposed and stayed and to be used at the discretion of the agent.
Maintain full employment and or schooling.
Parenting Class
Referral to Vocational and Rehabilitation program
Cognitive intervention program
30 hours of Community service
Letter of apology to: J, C Penney
No contact with: JC Penney	
Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges(including DNA) within 4 Months. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept.  
Court order all other non mandatory cost, fees and surcharges waived due to indigency 
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement
 Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Documents received and filed.
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief
Pretrial Incarceration form

Defendant Keyara A Hall-Jefferson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if she/ is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.    Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Documents received and filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum 
Elements of the Offense/ Jury Instruction.

Defendant Keyara A Hall-Jefferson in court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
